options.label: A
options.text: Arbitrators may be biased towards individuals

options.label: B
options.text: Arbitrators may be biased towards companies that give them cases

options.label: C
options.text: Arbitration is always fair and unbiased

options.label: D
options.text: Arbitration is only used in civil cases

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: They are less representative of the general population

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Congress

options.label: C
options.text: The President

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: 100 grams

options.label: C

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: How did the invention of the flush toilet impact the understanding of hygiene and disease?

options.label: A
options.text: It reinforced the "bad air" theory of disease, delaying the understanding of sanitation's role in preventing disease.

options.label: B
options.text: It had a minor impact on the understanding of hygiene and disease.

options.label: C
options.text: It contributed to a shift away from the "bad air" theory and towards a better understanding of the role of sanitation in preventing disease, although this took time.

options.label: D
options.text: It primarily improved agricultural practices.

multiple-choice.question: What is the most effective way to reduce the number of people dying from diarrhea?

options.label: A
options.text: Building more public toilets alone

options.label: B
options.text: Improving access to clean water, sanitation, and hygiene education

options.label: C
options.text: Providing more medical treatment for diarrhea

options.label: D
options.text: Increasing funding for medical research on diarrhea

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between the invention of the flush toilet and the reduction in cholera cases?

options.label: A
options.text: There is no direct relationship between the two.

options.label: B
options.text: The invention of the flush toilet led to an immediate reduction in cholera cases.

options.label: C
options.text: The invention of the flush toilet, combined with the development of modern sewage systems and changes in understanding of disease, contributed to a reduction in cholera cases over time.

options.label: D
options.text: The invention of the flush toilet caused an increase in cholera cases.

multiple-choice.question: How many public toilets did ancient Rome have?

options.label: D
options.text: None

multiple-choice.question: What concept significantly influenced the development of modern sanitation?

options.label: A
options.text: The discovery of germs

options.label: B
options.text: The idea of "bad air" causing disease

options.label: C
options.text: The concept of innate sense of disgust, which led to the avoidance of filth

options.label: D
options.text: The development of modern medicine

multiple-choice.question: What is the most effective way to reduce the number of people dying from polio?

options.label: A
options.text: Building more public toilets

options.label: B
options.text: Providing better nutrition, family planning, and access to vaccines

options.label: C
options.text: Providing more medical treatment for polio

options.label: D
options.text: Increasing funding for medical research on polio

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between the support of Bill and Melinda Gates and the reduction in cases of diseases such as polio?

options.label: A
options.text: There is no relationship between the two.

options.label: B
options.text: The support of Bill and Melinda Gates caused an increase in cases of diseases such as polio.

options.label: C
options.text: The support of Bill and Melinda Gates contributed to a reduction in cases of diseases such as polio through investments in global health initiatives.

options.label: D
options.text: The support of Bill and Melinda Gates had no impact on the number of cases of diseases such as polio.

multiple-choice.question: How many cases of polio were reported in 1988?
What was the invention of the flush toilet a major factor in the development of?

options.label: A
options.text: Modern agriculture

options.label: B
options.text: Ancient society

options.label: C
options.text: Modern medicine

options.label: D
options.text: Modern sanitation and public health systems

title: What happens during a heart attack? - Krishna Sudhir

multiple-choice.question: What is the world's leading killer, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: Heart attacks

options.label: B
options.text: Cardiovascular disease

options.label: C
options.text: Stroke

options.label: D
options.text: Cancer

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary cause of a heart attack?

options.label: A
options.text: Fatty deposits on the walls of the coronary arteries

options.label: B
options.text: Blockages in the veins

options.label: C
options.text: Inflammation of the heart muscle

options.label: D
options.text: Abnormal heart rhythm

options.label: A
options.text: Myocardial infarction

options.label: B
options.text: Heart failure

options.label: C
options.text: Cardiac arrest

options.label: D
options.text: Stroke

options.label: A
options.text: Shortness of breath

options.label: B
options.text: Chest pain

options.label: C
options.text: Weakness

options.label: D
options.text: Fatigue

multiple-choice.question: How can a heart attack be prevented?

options.label: A
options.text: Only through medication

options.label: B
options.text: Only through lifestyle changes

options.label: C
options.text: Through a combination of lifestyle changes and medication

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: Exercise and a healthy diet

options.label: B
options.text: Avoiding tobacco use and staying fit

options.label: C
options.text: Getting plenty of sleep and enjoying laughter

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: B
options.text: To close off a blocked artery

options.label: C
options.text: To hold the artery open

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: B

options.label: C

title: How small are we in the scale of the universe? - Alex Hofeldt

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Cassiopeia

options.label: D
options.text: Scorpius

options.label: A

options.label: C
options.text: It was a small, dark area of the universe, away from light pollution

What is the approximate diameter of the Earth?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: 380,000 kilometers (the distance to the moon)

options.label: C
options.text: 12,700 kilometers

options.label: D
options.text: 1.4 million kilometers (the diameter of the Sun)

multiple-choice.question: What do the Deep Field images reveal about the universe's structure on a large scale?

options.label: B
options.text: The universe is homogeneous and similar in different areas

options.label: C
options.text: The universe is finite and bounded

options.label: D
options.text: The universe is infinite and endless

options.text: All 10,000 galaxies observed

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: In the context of the universe, what is the finite speed of light related to?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The age of the universe

options.label: C
options.text: The link between space and time

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: To predict the universe's future state

options.label: D
options.text: To study the formation of stars

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: Would winning the lottery make you happier? - Raj Raghunathan

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome for 22 lottery winners in terms of their average reported levels of happiness months after winning, compared to a control group who hadn't won the lottery?

options.label: A
options.text: Their happiness levels increased significantly more than the control group.

options.label: B
options.text: Their happiness levels increased no more than the control group.

options.label: C
options.text: Their happiness levels decreased significantly compared to the control group.

options.label: D
options.text: The study found a significant correlation between winning the lottery and long-term happiness.

multiple-choice.question: What phenomenon describes our tendency to adapt to new situations to maintain a stable emotional state?

options.label: A
options.text: Emotional equilibrium

options.label: B
options.text: Hedonic escalation

options.label: C
options.text: Hedonic adaptation

options.label: D
options.text: Emotional homeostasis

multiple-choice.question: According to research, what is the general trend in human emotional well-being throughout our existence?

options.label: A
options.text: It increases with age, wealth, and status.

options.label: B
options.text: It decreases with age, wealth, and status.

options.label: C
options.text: It stays relatively constant, with some fluctuations.

options.label: D
options.text: It becomes more unstable with age, wealth, and status.

multiple-choice.question: What happened to the reported levels of happiness of people who had suffered an accident that left them paralyzed, according to a study?

options.label: A
options.text: They reported significantly lower levels of happiness.

options.label: B
options.text: They reported levels of happiness approaching their original baseline.

options.label: C
options.text: They reported increased levels of happiness.

options.label: D
options.text: The study did not examine the long-term effects on happiness.

multiple-choice.question: What are some potential challenges that lottery winners may face, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: Managing large sums of money wisely and avoiding taxes.

options.label: B
options.text: Maintaining social connections and making smart investment decisions.

options.label: C
options.text: Only difficulties in managing large sums of money.

options.label: D
options.text: Both difficulties in managing large sums of money and social isolation due to unwelcome requests for money.

multiple-choice.question: According to one study, what was the outcome for participants who spent money on others compared to those who spent it on themselves?

options.label: A
options.text: There was no significant difference in happiness levels.

options.label: B
options.text: Those who spent it on themselves were significantly happier.

options.label: C
options.text: Those who spent it on others were significantly happier.

options.label: D
options.text: The study did not measure happiness levels.

multiple-choice.question: What did a study of over 200,000 people from 136 countries find regarding the relationship between generosity and happiness?

options.label: A
options.text: There was no significant difference in happiness levels between those who donated and those who didn't.

options.label: B
options.text: People who donated tended to be unhappier than those who didn't.

options.label: C
options.text: People who donated tended to be happier than those who didn't in over 90% of the countries studied.

options.label: D
options.text: The study only found this relationship in certain countries.

multiple-choice.question: What is an effect of hedonic adaptation on human emotional sensitivity, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: It makes us more sensitive to changes in our lives.

options.label: B
options.text: It makes us less emotionally sensitive to any kind of change, including negative ones.

options.label: C
options.text: It has no effect on sensitivity to change.

options.label: D
options.text: It only affects sensitivity to positive changes.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, how do humans adapt to extrinsic and material things compared to novel experiences?

options.label: A
options.text: We adapt to novel experiences faster than we do to extrinsic and material things.

options.label: B
options.text: We adapt to extrinsic and material things much faster than we do to novel experiences.

options.label: C
options.text: There is no significant difference in adaptation rates.

options.label: D
options.text: The transcript does not compare adaptation rates.

multiple-choice.question: What is a suggested way to increase happiness when spending money, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: Spend money on material possessions and things.

options.label: B
options.text: Spend money on experiences, such as travel or learning a new skill.

options.label: C
options.text: Spend money on oneself rather than others.

options.label: D
options.text: Spend money on both experiences and material possessions.

title: Everything you need to know to read Homer's "Odyssey" - Jill Dash

options.label: B
options.text: 8,000 lines

options.label: C
options.text: 12,000 lines

options.text: 20,000 lines

multiple-choice.question: How was the "Odyssey" originally composed and performed in Ancient Greece?

options.label: A
options.text: Written down and read by individuals

options.label: B
options.text: Performed by oral poets called rhapsodes for listeners

options.label: C
options.text: Recited by a single person for a small audience

options.label: D
options.text: Sung by a choir for a large crowd

multiple-choice.question: What does the word "rhapsode" mean in the context of Ancient Greek poetry?

options.label: A
options.text: A poet who writes original works

options.label: B
options.text: A poet who recites existing poetry for a small audience

options.label: C
options.text: A poet who stitches together existing stories, jokes, myths, and songs

options.label: D
options.text: A poet who composes music for poetry

multiple-choice.question: What is the main theme that unites the "Odyssey" and its predecessor, the "Iliad"?

options.label: A
options.text: The importance of hospitality in Ancient Greek culture

options.label: B
options.text: The power of love in overcoming adversity

options.label: C
options.text: The danger of incurring the wrath of the gods

options.label: D
options.text: The value of knowledge in achieving success

multiple-choice.question: What is xenia in Ancient Greek culture, and how does it relate to the "Odyssey"?

options.label: A
options.text: A system of government in Ancient Greece, focusing on the rule of kings

options.label: B
options.text: A form of entertainment in Ancient Greece, featuring music and dance

options.label: C
options.text: A type of food in Ancient Greece, often served at banquets

options.label: D
options.text: A code of conduct for hosts and guests, emphasizing generosity and courtesy

multiple-choice.question: Why did Odysseus's passage home become fraught with mishap, according to the "Odyssey"?

options.label: A
options.text: He was being pursued by the gods for his hubris

options.label: B
options.text: He had angered the sea god Poseidon by blinding his son, a cyclops

options.label: C
options.text: He was on a quest for treasure and riches

options.label: D
options.text: He was searching for his family and encountering various obstacles

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the "Odyssey" being a sequel to the "Iliad" in terms of its narrative?

options.label: A
options.text: It provides a new perspective on the Trojan War and its aftermath

options.label: B
options.text: It introduces a new hero and a new storyline

options.label: C
options.text: It continues the story of Odysseus's journey after the Trojan War

options.label: D
options.text: It provides a detailed account of Ancient Greek history and culture

multiple-choice.question: Why does the narrative of the "Odyssey" begin in medias res?

options.label: A
options.text: To provide a detailed account of Odysseus's past and his experiences

options.label: B
options.text: To introduce the reader to the world of the "Odyssey" and its characters

options.label: C
options.text: To provide a historical context for the story and its events

options.label: D
options.text: To start the story at a critical point in the hero's journey, where he is trapped on an island

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the "Odyssey" containing a wealth of detail about its time period?

options.label: A
options.text: It provides a detailed account of Ancient Greek history and culture

options.label: B
options.text: It allows historians and readers to understand the culture and society of Ancient Greece

options.label: C
options.text: It provides a unique perspective on the world of the "Odyssey" and its characters

options.label: D
options.text: It allows readers to imagine the world of the "Odyssey" and its events

multiple-choice.question: What is the cultural significance of the "Odyssey" making its own long journey through centuries of myth and history?

options.label: A
options.text: It provides a detailed account of Ancient Greek history and culture

options.label: B
options.text: It demonstrates the enduring legacy and influence of the "Odyssey" on literature and culture

options.label: C
options.text: It provides a unique perspective on the world of the "Odyssey" and its characters

options.label: D
options.text: It allows readers to imagine the world of the "Odyssey" and its events
